message:
*   Use Kamal for deployment by default, which includes generating a Rails-specific config/deploy.yml.
    This can be skipped using --skip-kamal. See more: https://kamal-deploy.org/

    *DHH*

html:
Use Kamal for deployment by default, which includes generating a Rails-specific config/deploy.yml.
This can be skipped using –skip-kamal. See more: https://kamal-deploy.org/

DHH

message:
*   The guide _Classic to Zeitwerk HOWTO_ that documented how to migrate from
    the `classic` autoloader to Zeitwerk has been deleted.

    The last version of this guide can be found
    [here](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/v7.2/classic_to_zeitwerk_howto.html),
    in case you need it.

    *Petrik de Heus*
author: Xavier Noria
html:
The guide Classic to Zeitwerk HOWTO that documented how to migrate from
the classic autoloader to Zeitwerk has been deleted.

The last version of this guide can be found
here,
in case you need it.

Petrik de Heus

message:
*   `ActiveRecord::Encryption::Encryptor` now supports a `:compressor` option to customize the compression algorithm used.

    ```ruby
    module ZstdCompressor
      def self.deflate(data)
        Zstd.compress(data)
      end

      def self.inflate(data)
        Zstd.decompress(data)
      end
    end

    class User
      encrypts :name, compressor: ZstdCompressor
    end
    ```

    You disable compression by passing `compress: false`.

    ```ruby
    class User
      encrypts :name, compress: false
    end
    ```

    *heka1024*
author: heka1024
html:
ActiveRecord::Encryption::Encryptor now supports a :compressor option to customize the compression algorithm used.

module ZstdCompressor
  def self.deflate(data)
    Zstd.compress(data)
  end

  def self.inflate(data)
    Zstd.decompress(data)
  end
end

class User
  encrypts :name, compressor: ZstdCompressor
end

You disable compression by passing compress: false.

class User
  encrypts :name, compress: false
end

heka1024

message:
*   Add condensed `#inspect` for `ConnectionPool`, `AbstractAdapter`, and
    `DatabaseConfig`.

    *Hartley McGuire*
author: Hartley McGuire
html:
Add condensed #inspect for ConnectionPool, AbstractAdapter, and
DatabaseConfig.

Hartley McGuire

message:
*   Add `.shard_keys`, `.sharded?`, & `.connected_to_all_shards` methods.

    ```ruby
    class ShardedBase < ActiveRecord::Base
        self.abstract_class = true

        connects_to shards: {
          shard_one: { writing: :shard_one },
          shard_two: { writing: :shard_two }
        }
    end

    class ShardedModel < ShardedBase
    end

    ShardedModel.shard_keys => [:shard_one, :shard_two]
    ShardedModel.sharded? => true
    ShardedBase.connected_to_all_shards { ShardedModel.current_shard } => [:shard_one, :shard_two]
    ```

    *Nony Dutton*
author: Nony Dutton
html:
Add .shard_keys, .sharded?, & .connected_to_all_shards methods.

class ShardedBase < ActiveRecord::Base
    self.abstract_class = true

    connects_to shards: {
      shard_one: { writing: :shard_one },
      shard_two: { writing: :shard_two }
    }
end

class ShardedModel < ShardedBase
end

ShardedModel.shard_keys => [:shard_one, :shard_two]
ShardedModel.sharded? => true
ShardedBase.connected_to_all_shards { ShardedModel.current_shard } => [:shard_one, :shard_two]

Nony Dutton

message:
*   Optimize `Relation#exists?` when records are loaded and the relation has no conditions.

    This can avoid queries in some cases.

    *fatkodima*
author: fatkodima
html:
Optimize Relation#exists? when records are loaded and the relation has no conditions.

This can avoid queries in some cases.

fatkodima

by these values.

message:
*   Allow to configure `strict_loading_mode` globally or within a model.

    Defaults to `:all`, can be changed to `:n_plus_one_only`.

    *Garen Torikian*

html:
Allow to configure strict_loading_mode globally or within a model.

Defaults to :all, can be changed to :n_plus_one_only.

Garen Torikian

message:

    Reflects if the relation has been marked as readonly.

    *Theodor Tonum*
author: Carlos Antonio da Silva
html:
Add ActiveRecord::Relation#readonly?.

Reflects if the relation has been marked as readonly.

Theodor Tonum

message:
*   Improve `ActiveRecord::Store` to raise a descriptive exception if the column is not either
    structured (e.g., PostgreSQL +hstore+/+json+, or MySQL +json+) or declared serializable via
    `ActiveRecord.store`.

    Previously, a `NoMethodError` would be raised when the accessor was read or written:

        NoMethodError: undefined method `accessor' for an instance of ActiveRecord::Type::Text

    Now, a descriptive `ConfigurationError` is raised:

        ActiveRecord::ConfigurationError: the column 'metadata' has not been configured as a store.
          Please make sure the column is declared serializable via 'ActiveRecord.store' or, if your
          database supports it, use a structured column type like hstore or json.

    *Mike Dalessio*
author: Mike Dalessio
html:
Improve ActiveRecord::Store to raise a descriptive exception if the column is not either
structured (e.g., PostgreSQL +hstore+/+json+, or MySQL +json+) or declared serializable via
ActiveRecord.store.

Previously, a NoMethodError would be raised when the accessor was read or written:

NoMethodError: undefined method `accessor' for an instance of ActiveRecord::Type::Text

Now, a descriptive ConfigurationError is raised:

ActiveRecord::ConfigurationError: the column 'metadata' has not been configured as a store.
  Please make sure the column is declared serializable via 'ActiveRecord.store' or, if your
  database supports it, use a structured column type like hstore or json.

Mike Dalessio

message:
*   Fix inference of association model on nested models with the same demodularized name.

    E.g. with the following setup:

    ```ruby
    class Nested::Post < ApplicationRecord
      has_one :post, through: :other
    end
    ```

    Before, `#post` would infer the model as `Nested::Post`, but now it correctly infers `Post`.

    *Joshua Young*
author: Joshua Young
html:
Fix inference of association model on nested models with the same demodularized name.

E.g. with the following setup:

class Nested::Post < ApplicationRecord
  has_one :post, through: :other
end

Before, #post would infer the model as Nested::Post, but now it correctly infers Post.

Joshua Young

message:
*   Add public method for checking if a table is ignored by the schema cache.

    Previously, an application would need to reimplement `ignored_table?` from the schema cache class to check if a table was set to be ignored. This adds a public method to support this and updates the schema cache to use that directly.

    ```ruby
    ActiveRecord.schema_cache_ignored_tables = ["developers"]
    ActiveRecord.schema_cache_ignored_table?("developers")
    => true
    ```

    *Eileen M. Uchitelle*
author: eileencodes
html:
Add public method for checking if a table is ignored by the schema cache.

Previously, an application would need to reimplement ignored_table? from the schema cache class to check if a table was set to be ignored. This adds a public method to support this and updates the schema cache to use that directly.

ActiveRecord.schema_cache_ignored_tables = ["developers"]
ActiveRecord.schema_cache_ignored_table?("developers")
=> true

Eileen M. Uchitelle

message:
*   Support `immutable` directive in Cache-Control

    ```ruby
    expires_in 1.minute, public: true, immutable: true
    # Cache-Control: public, max-age=60, immutable
    ```

    *heka1024*
author: heka1024
html:
Support immutable directive in Cache-Control

expires_in 1.minute, public: true, immutable: true
# Cache-Control: public, max-age=60, immutable

heka1024

message:
*   Add `:wasm_unsafe_eval` mapping for `content_security_policy`

    ```ruby
    # Before
    policy.script_src "'wasm-unsafe-eval'"

    # After
    policy.script_src :wasm_unsafe_eval
    ```

    *Joe Haig*
author: Cyril Blaecke
html:
Add :wasm_unsafe_eval mapping for content_security_policy

# Before
policy.script_src "'wasm-unsafe-eval'"

# After
policy.script_src :wasm_unsafe_eval

Joe Haig

message:
*   Add a new configuration value `:zone` for `ActiveSupport.to_time_preserves_timezone` and rename the previous `true` value to `:offset`. The new default value is `:zone`.

    *Jason Kim*, *John Hawthorn*
author: Jason Kim
html:
Add a new configuration value :zone for ActiveSupport.to_time_preserves_timezone and rename the previous true value to :offset. The new default value is :zone.

Jason Kim, John Hawthorn
